intro: Forasaccus marginatus, commonly known as the marginated forasaccus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
